Record.ClassificationPath: Skin and Connective Tissue Diseases/Connective Tissue Diseases/Mucinoses/Scleromyxedema
Record.Description: A connective tissue disorder characterized by widespread thickening of SKIN with a cobblestone-like appearance. It is caused by proliferation of FIBROBLASTS and deposition of MUCIN in the DERMIS in the absence of thyroid disease. Most scleromyxedema cases are associated with a MONOCLONAL GAMMOPATHY, immunoglobulin IgG-lambda.
